page.title: 15TOURISM CARNGLAZE CAVERNS
page.content: Just out of the village is the tourist attraction of the Carnglaze slate caverns.There, two large caverns have been cut into the hillside,one at a higher level than the other.Many of the old buildings in St Neot were built from slate from these caverns.The underground quarries are now open to the public and are artificially lit.The larger, lower cavern has two pools of water which are unexpectedly clear.During World War Two the abandoned slate quarries of St Neot were used to store the spare supplies of naval rum.
